data.title: Incredible!!!!
data.text: I take my kids here often and have never been let down.  We have also done a birthday party with them and could not be happier.  The staff are younger kids and are amazing interacting with the kids that are the customers.  They play hard with the kids and have a huge amount of interaction.  This place is amazing and worth every penny.  Great job.

data.title: Perfect for bday parties
data.text:
Booked Up In The Air bday package on a Sunday afternoon and expected typical weekend chaos. Instead the staff was knowledgeable, friendly, professional. Bday parties/groups were spaced appropriately, there is plenty of room to store gifts, even your cake. Safety with fun is their top priority. Even a guest of ours who had ziplined in tropical forests (pretty unbeatable) had a great time. Party hosts detail-oriented and good with the kiddos. (And parents like me with lots of questions!)
Tip: for parents taking pics we discovered you can walk behind the back wall, around the rock wall corner, to get to the 'window wall' on the west side. Better pics with the window behind you, no glare or shadows. 
Final point:worth the money for whatever package you choose.

data.title: Kids love this place
data.text: took my kids to this.  They loved it.  Staff is friendly.  They can handle big crowds.  My children never had to wait more than 5 minutes.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: We had our daughters Birthday party here after going to one for a friend. My daughter loved it and so did all of her friends. They have different zip lines so you can go to the highest, shortest, go together like a swing etc. The best part is the people working there have a ton of fun with the kids which my daughter loved. They try to grab their shoes they just have fun! They also a great spot for parents to watch at tables, very comfortable and you can keep an eye on the kiddos. Good place to go! They also have an area for little kids.

data.title: A great active indoor adventure for kids.
data.text: Lynn and I and a couple of friends took our 7 year old granddaughters to Mid Air Adventures.  The kids can ride in zip lines, swings as well as climbing on the climbing wall. The kids are harnessed up almost the minute that they arrive. They are given a quick safety talk. Our kids loved this adventure and spent most of their time in the zip lines and on the climbing wall. The kids get a wrist ban which identifies how long they can play. Mid Air adventures is very well supervised and we did not feel at all uncomfortable letting our kids enjoy the facility.  The price was $17 for each child when we were there. For that the kids were able to play for a timed hour and a half. I am sure that the kids will want the go back.

data.title: Timed just right
data.text:
We called ahead before going to Mid-Air Adventures for the first time.  The employee that answered the phone let me know that a large party would be there at the time I requested and suggested a later time slot.  I'm really glad she did because when we arrived (Boulder schools had day off, but other districts didn't), there were only 2 other kids.  So, my boys were lucky enough to be able to got on the zip lines and other activities over and over without any wait.

The employees were very engaged in ensuring that the kids were having lots of fun.

I'd highly recommend this place for ages 5-12 (maybe higher, but I'm not sure what older kids are into these days).  I'd also highly recommend finding an off-time to visit.  I can imagine the place is a bit of a madhouse when full of kids running around.

data.title: Grandchildren Loved It
data.text: First visit with the grandkids, ages 5, 7, 9, and they had a great time.  We had a buy two get one free admission coupon that saved $16.  They went on the zip line and swing dozens of times in the 90 minutes.  Only a few kids there on a Saturday afternoon and the staff dedicated their time to them.  Socks aren't needed and the facility is very clean so our kids went barefoot after their crocs flew off during the rides.

data.title: Pricey fun
data.text: The place is very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. I rate it as only average due to cost. It is not the kind of place you bring your child solo. At $16.00 per kid times two kids that's $32.00 for one and half hours of entertainment. There are certainly better values to be had. On the up side my daughter and her friend did have a blast and it did tire them out. It wasn't very busy the day we went so they stayed active so your experience may vary

data.title: Zipline Fun for the Young (and Young at Heart)
data.text: Mid Air Adventures was a great diversion on a hot summer day. My 11 year old and his 7 year old cousin had a great time ziplining and swinging and rock climbing. My 14 year old didn't quite catch the thrill. Though it was kinda fun - she wanted longer runs. I actually wore a harness and did some ziplining and rock climbing as well. Fun to race. Fun to climb. The fun was also diminished some when a couple parties of very young (4-5 yos) arrived on scene. I was good at a half hour. The kids were ready to take off after a couple hours. The price was right - about the cost of a movie - for 2 hours of entertainment. Good way to get the energy out on a summer (or winter) afternoon.

data.title: Good Time For the Right Aged Kids
data.text:
This used to be called Jungle Quest and my sons have been to a few parties here over the years and recently about a week ago with a small group.  We had a coupon and decided to go early on a Sunday so it wasn't super crowded.  You pay for about a two hour session.  My group had kids from 8 to 10 and I really feel like that's the right age for this activity.  I'm sure older tweens may become easily bored and kids 4-5 are just too small in my opinion.  Kids are put into their harnesses and unless adults also pay, they aren't allowed up on the platforms and the kids have to be able to follow arrows to the exit and unhook themselves.  There was one little girl, about 4, there at our most recent visit and at least three times she walked into the path of a swinging, older kid.

Older teens seem to run the place, I didn't see anyone older than 20 besides other parents.  I felt like the kids were safe but there were two young employees making eyes at each other for most of our visit.  I'd feel better about less flirting and more making sure my kid doesn't fall on his head.
